alert.note: Alert for Taliaferro; Warren (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 3:09AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Warren, northeastern Hancock, central Glascock and southeastern Taliaferro Counties through 345 AM EDT... At 309 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Barnett to near Mayfield to Sparta, and moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Warrenton, Sparta, Gibson, Norwood, Mitchell, Sharon, Camak, Shoals, Jewell, Beall Springs, Mayfield, Powelton, Barnett, Agricola, Reese, Bastonville and Culverton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
